page.title: 02PHYSICAL LANDSCAPE..
page.content: The main features of the physical geography of this part of N.E. Fife are the gently rounded hills sloping down to the wide , flat valley floor or strath through which runs the River Eden .The altitude range is 118 metres, the highest point being in the north on Weddersbie Hill(156m) and the lowest(38m) in the south on the valley floor. The area has a south_south_east aspect.The soil in general is deep and fertile, especially in the valley , but there are a few rock outcrops occurring in the northern part of the map. The area is mostly well drained, but on the flatter land in the south, closer to the river, there are some areas of marsh. In the north on Weddersbie Hill there is a small loch called Red Myre.
